field.name: Interactivity - level
field.definition: the level of interaction between a resource and end user; that is the degree to which the learner can influence the behavior of the resource

levelAndDeftn.levelDeftn: the name of the group or organization responsible for the controlled vocabulary
the level of interaction between a resource and end user; see the allowed combination of terms below; the resource part of the term is the phrase after the last colon

terms.termAndDeftn: learner interactions determine various paths through a resource; learner actions result in different and undetermined outcomes from learner to learner based on the actions chosen
learner interactions determine various paths through a resource; learner actions result in different but known outcomes from learner to learner
learner interactions determine various paths through a resource; students observe and answer questions but all learners arrive at generally the same outcome
generally a single path takes a learner through a resource; no learner interactions occur rather generally observations
the resource is not intended to be interactive

dos.practice: Choose one interactivity level term that best describes the overall interactivity of the resource.
Use for resources that are intended for student learning like lesson plans, case studies, activities, course, curriculums and other types of learning materials.

donts.practice: Do not use this field if it does not add useful information to the overall understanding of the resource.
Do not use this field if the information is not easily determined, that is it could have multiple interactivity levels.
